abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Improved Access to
            Water and Sanitation Services Project is to promote,
            following an output-based approach, the connection to water
            and sanitation services of about 11,300 low income
            beneficiary households selected in disadvantaged peri-urban
            and rural National Initiative for Human Development (INDH)
            neighborhoods in the urban centers of Casablanca, Tangiers
            and Meknes in the territory of the Kingdom of Morocco. The
            change is the extension of the closing date of the project
            by 12 months from its current closing date of December 31.
            2009 to December 31, 2010.  The extension is necessary to
            allow the full utilization of the Grant's proceeds.
            Some delays in the implementation have been due to obstacles
            independent from the three service providers regarding which
            encouraging progress have been noted during the last
            supervision mission. In addition to this, the current
            numbers of household connected do not reflect the current
            progress in the extension of distribution lines within the
            targeted areas which will soon lead to a higher rate of
            household connections. The extension will allow further
            achieving the project's development objective through
            the provision of subsidized access to water and sanitation
            to an additional 8,500 poor households currently without
            services. The restructuring does not introduce any specific
            new risks.
